roleset.name: cause (us. emotional reaction)

role.descr: thing provoked, or reaction when separate secondary impelled agent is present
secondary impelled agent, when separate from reaction

example.name: basic case
example.text: Economists say a buildup in inventories can provoke cutbacks in production that can lead to a recession.
example.arg: cutbacks in production that can lead to a recession

example.name: misparsed object
example.text: The compromise bill passed the House last week but has now provoked jurisdictional fights with the Senate Foreign Relations Committee, which jealously protects its prerogatives over operations at the State Department.
example.arg: [ jurisdictional fights] [ with the Senate Foreign Relations Committee, which jealously protects its prerogatives over operations at the State Department]

example.name: with separate secondary impelled agent
example.text: To say that the Pentagon should act irresponsibly because acting responsibly will provoke Congress into acting irresponsibly leads to the conclusion that the Pentagon should deliberately exaggerate its needs in the national interest; in other words, that it is justified in committing a crime -- lying to Congress -- because it is morally superior.
